description.narrative:
Stakeholder Effects: IFC anticipates the project will provide up to US$25 million in long-term financing for SME and climate financing projects. Expected impact includes: i) increase in accessibility of financing for NMB's SME clients, which will ultimately facilitate job creation and income generation in Nepal; and ii) reduction of GHG emissions in Nepal through financing extended by NMB to green sub-projects.
Market Impact: Increase competitiveness of SME financing: The high-risk structure for SME lending, absence of appropriate credit methodologies, and lack of product differentiation restricts expansion and innovation in SME financing. IFC's focused lending towards SMEs will demonstrate sustainability of lending to this segment and support increase in overall banking credit to the SME sector. IFC anticipates that the project will also have sustainability market impact as it supports NMB contribution to the country's effort in addressing climate change challenges by developing a new asset class that promotes greater market sustainability.

The proposed investment comprises of a 3 to 5 years senior loan of up to US$25 million to be extended to NMB Bank Limited (the Bank). Through the investment, IFC will support NMB in raising long term funding for its lending program to Small and Medium Enterprise (SME), as well as green sub projects in Nepal (the Project).
